content: Good stuff. Certainly food for thought for the weekend. Like I needed more to think about. Thanks? :) Don’t you think there’s a difference between “Can it scale?” and “Will we unshamefully scale it?” That is, just because you’ve riding with your foot on the brake doesn’t mean there’s gas in the tank, right? I mean, if you’re not thinking some sort of exit strategy are you still an entrepreneur? Doesn’t being exit-minded force a certain amount of focus and discipline that could be missing otherwise? Certainly Guilizzoni has a good thing going. Kudos to him. But my sense is, he’s closer to an uber successful SMB than an semi-successful entrepreneur. Apples and oranges really, yes? True, it’s worked out well, so far. But is he full legit or just an outlier? My sense is there are plenty of others who tried the same and were overrun and/or eaten by a scale-loving adversary. Is there another Guilizzoni somewhere kicking herself for the same approach? (Hint: Probably many.) Again, great food for thought. But perhaps some additional spices are also in order while we’re on the topic?
